seg.seg: ... (the Bodhisattva says:) «If he wishes for (the Buddha rank?) then he should constantly love compassion. Of all virtues ...
… if he wishes for (the Buddha rank?) then he should constantly love compassion. (cf Peyrot forth.)
... has become the cause.» || bahuprakāraṃ || «Whose thought more through compassion ...
... his behaviour is always directed towards the well-being of others; through the gift, tolerance and energy ...
Er richtet sein Verhalten stets zum Wohl anderer ein.
At all times he orientates his behaviour towards the well-being of others.
... even among the animals he does (not) cause fear; like a father he is to be trusted.
... always compassion. 1.» Having heard this, king Brahmadatta was amazed ...
... (and he says:) «O what an excellence of modesty! O (what) ... for the beings ...
... through this action. However this saṃsāra is in all manners ...
... (this gazelle) looks flawless to me. Look at the mighty one!» (||) śuriṣinnaṃ (||)
... «From now I will not go hunting and I will not kill anymore; I will even no longer eat (meat) ...
From now I will not go hunting and I will not kill anymore; I will even no longer eat (meat) … (cf Peyrot forth.)
... may I be standing under command of you, the good one. 1.» Thereupon the Bodhisattva (rose) from [his] throne ...
... (and says:) «... I will go into the forest. By nature the gazelle birth is horrible; it is an existence that cannot be compared to me.»
... may you carry out [your] royal [task] according to the law, also when I have [again] approached the gazelle flock ...
